message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.SI 

Reasoning: The paper deals with on-line prediction and regret analysis, which are topics commonly studied in the machine learning and statistics communities. The use of Banach-space methods suggests a focus on functional analysis, which is relevant to the subfield of learning theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of information theory in the analysis of prediction algorithms suggests cs.IT (Information Theory) as a possible sub-category. The focus on irregular prediction rules and the use of Banach spaces suggests cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as another possible sub-category. The use of prediction algorithms in the context of benchmark classes suggests cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the focus on on-line prediction and the analysis of regret suggests cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as a possible sub-category.
